info.name: Chatango - HTML5 optimizations and preferences
info.description: A style made for the HTML5 version of chatango that uses HTML5 and Javascript instead of Flash.
info.additionalInfo: To use this style, visit any chatango chatroom, but end the address with /?js to see the changes. Unaffected by this style is the color of the main interface elements outside of the chat fields and the graphical wait timer colors. 06/26/14 Added .own-msg to add color for your own messages. 06/26/14 einenlum helped out with the regexp string in use now to affect only Chatango chat pages, which keeps other expects of the site untampered. You cannot personalize per-room just yet, but maybe that will be figured out in the future. Maybe. This style will by default; - Add the Chatango logo (centered) - Remove borders from everything - Add a whitewash backdrop over text fields - Force all message text to use Arial (even with text styles on, I believe) - Force all username text to use Arial as a separate setting - Makes your own messages "Chatango blue" - Add text shadow to username text (Follow comment to enable, should make usernames easier to see) - Remove some of the top margin, and bottom left logo >> Recommended; https://userstyles.org/styles/80970 - Minimize avatars, and have avatars grow with hover - Make most elements transparent for an image - Let you adjust scrollbar colors (default colors used) - Add a large "Chatango" icon as an example background You can also add color to change text colors. You can change the background color for .msg near the bottom to adjust for the image and text settings you want to use, until you are satisfied with the overall look. Bugs: - Removes elements from .msg-fg and .msg-fg - .own-msg encompasses everything, so it affects .c_username for yourself too. I experimented with border-radius and it sucks. Don't bother trying.
